Home > examples > quadrotor > env > getPoly.m

getPoly

PURPOSE

poly Creates box polytope from upper/lower bounds

SYNOPSIS

function poly = getPoly(varargin)

DESCRIPTION 

 poly Creates box polytope from upper/lower bounds

 Input: 'x' [xmin xmax ymin ymax zmin zmax]
        'e' expansion/contraction factor
 Output: 'poly' MPT polytope object

 :copyright: 2014 by the California Institute of Technology
 :license: BSD 3-Clause, see LICENSE for details

This function is called by:
  • envLTL envLTL Creates environment (workspace)
  • envPt2Pt envPt2Pt Creates environment (workspace)

0011 if nargin == 1
0012     x = varargin{1};
0013     e = 0;
0014     
0015 elseif nargin == 2
0016     x = varargin{1};
0017     e = varargin{2};
0018     
0019 else
0020     error('Invalid number of arguments.');
0021 end
0022 
0023 
0024 if length(x) == 4
0025     xmin = x(1) - e;
0026     xmax = x(2) + e;
0027     ymin = x(3) - e;
0028     ymax = x(4) + e;
0029 
0030     poly = polytope([xmin ymin; xmax ymin; xmax ymax; xmin ymax]);
0031 
0032 elseif length(x) == 6
0033     xmin = x(1) - e;
0034     xmax = x(2) + e;
0035     ymin = x(3) - e;
0036     ymax = x(4) + e;
0037     zmin = x(5) - e;
0038     zmax = x(6) + e;
0039 
0040     poly = polytope([xmin ymin zmin; xmax ymin zmin; ...
0041                      xmin ymax zmin; xmin ymin zmax; ...
